poem:
Title: "Songs of the Digital Morning"

As dawn licks the screen,  
Houdini conjures a melody from the ether, 
And Dua Lipa, not fading but resilient, 
Her voice a spectral beacon in airwaves.  
Songs born of mechanical heartbeats, stream  
In grim determination - catchiness tinged with steel. 
Behold the steadfast songstress, her craft woven  
Between the silence and the server's hum.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Raye, Tate McRae and a bit of a rave: all the Brits 2024 performances reviewed Dua Lipa It would be inaccurate to say that Dua Lipa is entering her flop era – the first singles from her upcoming album, Houdini and Training Season, are currently in or around the top 20 most streamed songs globally on Spotify. But there’s something a little gimlet-eyed in how they’re written – catchy in a grimly determined rather than". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

But there’s something a little gimlet-eyed in how they’re written – catchy in a grimly determined rather than
